business.headline: Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

EPFO withdrawal, pension or transfer: How to choose the right PF formEPFO members often get confused about which form to fill for withdrawals, transfers, or pension claims. Using the right form not only saves time but also avoids delays or rejection of your application.

CA explains why 80% of emergency funds don't work when neededMost people believe they are financially prepared for tough times, but when a real crisis hits, their so-called emergency funds often fall short. A chartered accountant explains why this happens and how to fix it.

Online Gaming Bill 2025: What are the different penalties in it?The Bill, which was passed in the Lok Sabha soon after it was introduced, focusses on reducing risks linked to addiction, money laundering, and misleading advertising.

No GST on life, health insurance premiums soon? Here's what it means for youA proposal has been made to exempt premiums for life and health insurance from Goods and Services Tax (GST), a move that could bring down costs and boost insurance penetration.
Sensex opens 150 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; RIL gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 122.01 points to 81,979.85, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 20.45 points to 25,071.00 as of 9:23 am.

4 IPOs to close for bidding today: Which one will give you best listing gains?All four IPOs opened for subscription on August 19 and will complete allotment on August 22. The listing of these companies is scheduled for August 26 on the BSE and NSE.

Now you can buy land via a mobile app in minutes. Here's howThe initiative is intended to make land purchases easier, quicker and more transparent by using a platform that millions already rely on for daily shopping.

Will next-gen GST make homes more affordable?With the government considering a simpler two-slab GST structure, many are asking a key question: Will the new system finally make home buying more affordable?

Rapido fined Rs 10 lakh over false ads, regulator orders refunds to consumersThe penalty follows complaints that Rapido's ads such as "Guaranteed Auto" and "Auto in 5 min or get Rs 50" misled customers by creating the impression of guaranteed services.
Sensex ends 213 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 213.45 points to close at 81,857.84, while the NSE Nifty50 added 69.90 points to end at 25,050.55.

CA explains the risks behind 'No EMI till possession' schemesMany homebuyers are lured by "No EMI Till Possession" schemes, but a chartered accountant warns that these offers can carry hidden financial risks that may leave buyers paying for a property they never receive.

entertainment.headline: Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala visit Tirupati temple. WatchNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala visited the Tirumala Tirupati temple on Thursday. Their videos from their temple visit are now doing the rounds on social media.

Producer Naga Vamsi to get Rs 22 crore from YRF after War 2 Telugu losses: ReportYash Raj Films reportedly stepped in to compensate producer Naga Vamsi and partners after the Telugu version of 'War 2' underperformed at the box office. The film features Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan in lead roles.

Gia Manek marries Varunn Jain in intimate ceremony, calls it a forever unionTelevision actor Gia Manek has married Varunn Jain in an intimate ceremony. The couple shared wedding photos and announced their union on social media.

Hansika Motwani has hilarious reaction to people commenting on her life. WatchHansika Motwani is currently holidaying in Bali with her friend. Amid her divorce rumours, she shared a hilarious video of her reaction to reading comments about her personal life.

Can Ayushmann-Rashmika's Thama redefine vampire tales for Indian audiences?'Thama' is Bollywood's fresh take on vampire lore, blending Indian folklore with gothic romance. Can the film's success reshape Indian horror by localising Western myths authentically? Here's a glimpse at whether Indian audiences may fall in love with vampires the way West has.

KBC 17: Crorepati Aditya Kumar bows out at Rs 7 crore question, settles for 1 croreOn Kaun Banega Crorepati 17, Uttarakhand contestant Aditya Kumar impressed viewers by winning Rs 1 crore after narrowly missing the Rs 7 crore jackpot.

Nick Jonas's bizarre bed habit leaves fans calling him crazyNick Jonas has revealed his strict rule of using the bed only for sleeping, avoiding activities like eating or watching TV, which has surprised many fans. This quirky habit has sparked lively discussions on social media.

Emily in Paris 5: Lily Collins returns with a new adventure in December'Emily in Paris Season 5' explores new cultural landscapes in Italy while maintaining connections to Paris, as Emily faces career challenges and personal growth.

Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendNetflix's new weekend lineup features a mix of romance, thrillers and K-dramas. Here's a glimpse at the new shows and films to add to your binge-list.

Indian remakes of K-dramas, local languages: Korean giant CJ ENM's strategy for IndiaKorean content continues to capture Indian audiences with popular dramas and strategic local remakes. CJ ENM is deepening its presence by partnering with Indian platforms and expanding localisation to strengthen cultural ties.

Samantha on slowing down, new career chapter: Everything I do now matters moreSamantha Ruth Prabhu shifted focus to passion projects, prioritising wellness and quality over quantity. In an interview, she opened up about taking up lesser projects at a time.

Neena Gupta, at 65, owns her shorts look, shuts down troll who body-shamed herActor Neena Gupta clapped back at a troll mocking her airport attire. She was seen wearing a loose t-shirt and shorts for her airport look.

SRK, Gauri step aside as Aryan takes center stage at Bads of Bollywood eventActor Shah Rukh Khan and his producer wife Gauri Khan joined their son Aryan at the preview launch event for 'The Bads of Bollywood'. The upcoming Netflix show marks Aryan's directorial debut.

KJo, Ananya Panday praise Aryan's Bads of Bollywood preview: Absolute blockbusterKaran Johar, Ananya Panday and other Bollywood celebrities reacted to Aryan Khan's Bads of Bollywood preview. Karan and Ananya congratulated Aryan on his directorial.

Samantha opens up on social media pressure and online negativitySamantha Ruth Prabhu shared that while social media bring both praise and trolling, she manages it by staying authentic and taking breaks. The actor also credited the platform for helping her find mentors who positively influenced her life.

Bobby Deol recalls friendship with SRK, says Aryan is all set to conquer the worldBobby Deol spoke about his 30-year-old friendship with Shah Rukh Khan at the 'Bads of Bollywood' preview event. The series will premiere on September 18 on Netflix.

Aryan Khan bows down, gives first public speech at The Bads of Bollywood eventAryan Khan, who has made his directorial debut with 'The Bads of Bollywood', bowed down to the audience and asked for their forgiveness at the launch of the Netflix show. He explained that he was nervous as it was his first time addressing the crowd.

Nandamuri Balakrishna in tears at sister-in-law Padmaja's funeral, video goes viralNandamuri Padmaja, wife of Nandamuri Jayakrishna, died on August 19 in Hyderabad, leaving the Nandamuri family and fans in grief. A video of Balakrishna breaking down while meeting mourners has gone viral.

Ravi Teja's Mass Jathara postponed, producer Naga Vamsi addresses online rumours Ravi Teja's upcoming commercial entertainer 'Mass Jathara', initially scheduled for release on August 27, has been postponed. Producer Naga Vamsi confirmed the delay through a cryptic post on social media.

general news.headline: What happened has happened: Ahmedabad school stabber's chilling chatA Class 10 student of an Ahmedabad school was stabbed to death by his junior after an altercation, with a police probe uncovering a chilling chat.

How Trump is unifying Brics brick-by-brickThe Brics alliance has long been seen as a loosely structured bloc beset by a lack of trust in their own ranks. But in the face of Trump's tariff bombs, all of that is passe. While India has ramped up ties with Russia and China, South Africa and Brazil are also following suit.

Invited me to hotel: Malayalam actor accuses young Kerala politician of harassmentMalayalam actor Rini Ann George accused a young politician of sending offensive messages. The BJP demanded the resignation of Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil, even though the actor did not name anybody in particular.

How Pakistan's Failed Marshal Munir succeeded in wooing TrumpAfter Pakistan's drubbing by India in Op Sindoor, a failed Asim Munir promoted himself to Field Marshal. But the failed marshal succeeded in wooing US President Trump with oil, cryptocurrencies, rare-earth riches, and a Nobel dream, all of which are non-existent. This is how Munir humoured Trump in uniform.

Tourism, troops, warming: The triple threat to Ladakh's glaciersThe Himalayan glaciers are going through a churn as global warming and climate change begin to hit this delicate world, responsible for maintaining the balance of the cryosphere.

Students thrashed by traders in Kolkata, called Bangladeshi for speaking BengaliFour Calcutta University students were attacked in Kolkata's Sealdah after a clash with traders who allegedly called them Bangladeshi for speaking Bengali. Police have arrested two accused traders in relation to the case.

Why zero GST on insurance premiums doesn't mean cheaper policies for youOn the surface, removing GST on insurance premiums seems like a big relief, but experts caution that the outcome may not be what many are expecting.

The Real Bengal Files: From Calcutta Killings to Gandhi's MiracleIn the 1940s, Calcutta was torn by communal strife, political rivalry, and Partition's looming shadow. From the Lahore Resolution to the Great Calcutta Killings, the city symbolised India's turmoil — until Gandhi's presence turned it into a rare oasis of peace.

Binge-watching, Insta Reels are rewiring your brain like alcohol addictionSeveral studies suggest that short-form videos trigger reward pathways in ways similar to addictive substances like alcohol, while neurologists in India caution about long-term rewiring of motivation, focus, and even memory.

As Modi govt tables bills to prevent 'rule from jail', why Opposition smells a ployThe Modi government calls the three bills introduced by home minister Amit Shah as anti-corruption reform while critics allege executive overreach and political misuse

Stupidest tactical move: Economist Jeffrey Sachs blasts US over India tariffsRenowned American economist Jeffrey Sachs said the steep tariffs imposed on India were self-defeating and risk damaging one of America's most important relationships in Asia.

IED blast, the end: Pigeon carrying threat note caught near India-Pak borderSecurity was increased in Jammu after a pigeon carrying an attack threat note was caught near the border. Officials suspect the note could be a prank, raising concerns over border security.

Are engineers taking over India's civil services?Engineers increasingly dominate UPSC civil services recruitment, reducing humanities graduates' presence. This shift raises concerns about losing empathy and diverse perspectives in India's bureaucracy.

FBI arrests Cindy Singh, one of '10 most wanted fugitives' hiding in IndiaThe FBI, working closely with Indian authorities and Interpol, apprehended Singh, FBI Director Kash Patel confirmed. She has been transported back to the United States and will be handed over to Texas officials to face charges.

Pixel 10 launch: Top features, specs, India price, and all else you need to knowGoogle has taken the wraps off the Pixel 10, the newest member of its flagship smartphone family. Here is a look at the phone's top features, key specs, India price, and everything else.

UP man wanted wife to look like Nora Fatehi, denied her food, caused miscarriageA Ghaziabad woman alleged that her husband forced her to exercise for three hours daily and denied food whenever she failed to comply.

Banning Online Games: Economic Suicide That Fails to Curb AddictionA blanket ban on real-money gaming harms the economy, pushes users offshore, and ignores proven alternatives. Regulation, not prohibition, is the smart path to protect players and preserve innovation.

Jaishankar pushes for Russia firms to engage intensively with India amid US tariffsS Jaishankar urged Russian firms to step up engagement with India, warning that soaring trade figures mean little unless Moscow opens its market wider to Indian goods.

First picture of Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta after attack, meets 7 BJP MPsThe first picture of Rekha Gupta emerged a day after she was attacked during a public hearing at her Civil Lines residence. The accused, Rajesh Bhai Khimji, has been sent to a five-day police remand as Delhi Police probe a possible larger conspiracy.

Sanju Samson, who had forged a promising opening partnership with Abhishek Sharma, now finds his place under threat. Can the Kerala wicketkeeper-batter adapt, reinvent himself, and make his spot indispensable?

Mohammed Siraj's X-factor will be missed in Asia Cup 2025: Harbhajan SinghHarbhajan Singh feels that Mohammed Siraj should have been included in the Asia Cup squad. The former cricketer thinks that the pacer could have chipped in as the 'x-factor' for India during the upcoming tournament.

BCCI extends Ajit Agarkar's term as men's chief selector till June 2026: ReportBCCI has reportedly extended Ajit Agarkar's tenure as chairman of the senior men's selection committee till June 2026. This move comes after India's strong performances under his leadership, signalling stability amid upcoming cricketing challenges.

Sinquefield Cup: Gukesh held by Sevian, Praggnanandhaa draws with AbdusattorovWorld champion D Gukesh was held to a draw by the lone wild card, Samuel Sevian of the United States, while fellow Indian R Praggnanandhaa also split the points with Nodirbek Abdusattorov of Uzbekistan in the third round of the Sinquefield Cup.

Errani and Vavassori defeated Iga Swiatek and Casper Ruud in the final on Wednesday, August 20.

After Asia Cup snub, Mohammad Rizwan signs for CPL side St Kitts and Nevis PatriotsMohammad Rizwan is reportedly set to join St Kitts & Nevis Patriots for CPL 2025 after missing Pakistan's Asia Cup squad. Rizwan joins a strong Pakistan contingent at this year's CPL.

In the second game, Errani/ Vavassor defeated Collins/Harrison.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
